content.question: ​Which of the following includes the input-output pairs <math alttext="open parentheses 2 , 4 close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mn>2,4</mn></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="open parentheses 3 , 8 close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mn>3,8</mn></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​The arithmetic sequence <math alttext="a subscript n equals 4 n"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>n</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​The linear function <math alttext="f open parentheses n close parentheses equals 2 plus 4 open parentheses n minus 1 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>n</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

The geometric sequence ​<math alttext="g subscript n equals 2 to the power of open parentheses n minus 1 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>g</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​The exponential function <math alttext="h open parentheses n close parentheses equals 2 times 2 to the power of open parentheses n minus 1 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>n</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​The exponential function <math alttext="h open parentheses n close parentheses equals 2 times 2 to the power of open parentheses n minus 1 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>n</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.2: Change in Linear and Exponential Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
